-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Miscellaneous newtypes for orderings of discutable use.
--   
@package acme-miscorder
@version 0.1.0.0


-- | This module contains a collection of orderings of dubious utility,
--   inspired by <a>this</a> discussion on the haskell-cafe mailing-list.
module Acme.MiscOrder

-- | This newtype inverts the result of the (==) function.
newtype Contrarian a
Contrarian :: a -> Contrarian a

-- | This newtype is perfect to transform any sorting algorithm into a
--   lucky sort!
newtype LuckySortOrder a
LuckySortOrder :: a -> LuckySortOrder a

-- | This newtype does respects the equality relation lawsâ€¦by treating any
--   two values as equal
newtype Perverse a
Perverse :: a -> Perverse a

-- | This newtype gives a random result for any two inequal values. A
--   warning though: given that I didn't manage to memoize a polymorphic
--   function for use as a typeclass instance, its Ord instance can give
--   different results on different calls with the same arguments.
newtype Fiendish a
Fiendish :: a -> Fiendish a
instance Eq a => Eq (LuckySortOrder a)
instance Eq a => Eq (Fiendish a)
instance Show a => Show (Fiendish a)
instance Ord (Perverse a)
instance Eq (Perverse a)
instance Eq a => Ord (Fiendish a)
instance Ord a => Ord (LuckySortOrder a)
instance Eq a => Eq (Contrarian a)
